body:
This is only the beginning.

No doubt everyone has watched movies and TV shows, read books, even participated in seminars and events pertaining to all things related to magic.

Vampires, werewolves, witches, mermaids, goblins, zombies, elves, giants, dragons…each entity with their own unique stories, and each portrayed numerous times in different ways.

The Vampire Diaries television series is known for its portrayal of vampires, witches, and werewolves living harmoniously (sometimes) while tackling the inevitable horrors of normal life according to a supernatural being.

The ever brilliant Harry Potter franchise accompanied by its recent Fantastic Beasts spinoff throws a little of everything into the mix, giving cameos to werewolves, ghosts, witches and wizards, mermaids (though not nearly as pretty as they are typically portrayed), and many other exotic creatures of magic.

Of course it’s hard to forget the ongoing majesty of the hit television series Supernatural, which focuses its lens on that of ghosts, angels, and demons.

Cue J.R.R. Tolkien and his fantastic Lord of the Rings series where we meet elves, dwarves, and hobbits alike, along with a handful of wizards, namely Gandalf.

Yes, no doubt each of these, among many others are a hit, and undoubtedly will forever remain a part of America’s favorite fantasies. But, have we ever truly crossed the paths of all species of magic? Have we truly seen anything where all forms of the supernatural come together in one big bowl of fantasy? I’d say Harry Potter comes the closest to doing that, but still falls just short of a truly magical series in which we see literally all types of magical species live amongst one another.

I’m here to bring you such a series. A series where we can see mermaids actively partake in friendly conversation with vampires, and dragons escorting werewolves to annual events with elves and ghosts.

In the next post, I will outline the basics of each entity, giving you a firm foundation of their origins, including curses, birth rights, and how each came to exist. Please note, I do not and will not base any of these descriptions in folklore or legend. The beauty of fantasy fiction is, well, you can do pretty much whatever you want. So everything you read will come completely from my own mind, with as little influence as possible from the outside world. In the next post after that, we begin our long and powerful journey with The Entities. Let the magic begin!

summary: Up in Smoke: a marauders era rp To deny the war became impossible the day the Death Eaters attacked Diagon Alley. It happened in...
caption:
Up in Smoke: a marauders era rp

To deny the war became impossible the day the Death Eaters attacked Diagon Alley. It happened in the middle of day, in August while Hogwarts students were shopping for supplies and families were enjoying their morning. Seven killed and a dozen more injured. Peace in the wizarding world was over, ambivalence no longer an option. To the Death Eaters, you are one of them or you are the enemy. To fight against them paints a target on your back.

Even so, there are some who have chosen to fight - whether they a part of Dumbledore’s only whispered of group, the Order, or if they are finding some other way of resisting. They dream of a better world than this one, and they are not afraid to fight for that world - whatever the cost may be.

This is not the same world the Marauders knew when they were at Hogwarts. 1979 does not hold any of the sheltered hallways of their school days. There are questions of how much of the Dark Lord has infiltrated the ministry and the only thing you can trust in the papers are the obituaries. The illusion of safety is gone, and it is time to pick a side. War is burning, and you must decide where you stand.

More than just the illusion will go up in smoke.

Even so, there are some who have chosen to fight - whether they a part of Dumbledore’s only whispered of group, the Order, or if they are finding some other way of resisting. They dream of a better world than this one, and they are not afraid to fight for that world - whatever the cost may be.

This is not the same world the Marauders knew when they were at Hogwarts. 1979 does not hold any of the sheltered hallways of their school days. There are questions of how much of the Dark Lord has infiltrated the ministry and the only thing you can trust in the papers are the obituaries. The illusion of safety is gone, and it is time to pick a side. War is burning, and you must decide where you stand.

More than just the illusion will go up in smoke.

summary: Hermione did her best to push back her cheeky grin, forcing a somewhat annoyed expression to her face as she cleared her throat....
text:
Hermione did her best to push back her cheeky grin, forcing a somewhat annoyed expression to her face as she cleared her throat. ”Do you mind?” her voice sounding much like the Hermione of Hogwarts, back when she’d tell off this same man in shared lessons of old. When he shot her a look and resumed tapping, she couldn’t carry on and instead finally lost it, bursting out with a laugh that had her doubling over in her chair, holding her stomach as her eyes watered.

”Oh, I’m sorry,” she wheezed, looking like a right loon. ”It’s just… I never realized how terribly annoying it must have been to share lessons with me as a child. Ah-and you… You sounded j-just like when Bi-Binns would go off on a t-tangent talking to the bloody wall!” Hermione could barely speak for the laughter that the memories invoked. She recalled the lessons when Binns would blather on and on, not even facing his often-sleeping class, and Jaxon would be complaining under his breath or mimicking the ghostly professor or doing some other antics to entertain his classmates. ”Merlin, I used to threaten you with so many docked points and detentions for that…”

body:
I dunno know why this isn’t common knowledge after all these years but

Harry was not the child spoken of in the prophecy, it was actually Neville. Voldy just thought it meant Harry. The reason being that the boys share a birthday (another thing people seem to gloss over) and the fucking prophecy was vague as hell.

Goodnight.

summary: This fic/chapter goes out to three very special followers, @scoutstlaurent, @rikaisaprincess,  @hello-living-shadows, and...
body:
This fic/chapter goes out to three very special followers, @scoutstlaurent, @rikaisaprincess, @hello-living-shadows, and @queencheshirewolf because these four have been following this blog since the beginning.

I hope you enjoy :)

—————————————————————

Three girls went running as soon as they heard the news of Aster being in the infirmary that morning. Marigold was having breakfast when she overheard some Hufflepuff girls talk about what happened last night. As soon as Aster’s name was brought up, Marigold jumped and ran to them, asking what happened and where was Aster now. They only said a monster had attacked them and Aster wasn’t quick enough to run.

Marigold bolted from the dining hall toward the infirmary, ignoring all the Prefects who began docking Gryffindor points for running in the Halls.

Around the same time, Vivien was doing a book report when Lottie ran into the library and informed her of what happened to Aster. Lottie had overhear from some Hufflepuffs in the library of some creature sneaking into the Hufflepuff dorms and attacking Aster while she slept. Vivien jumped up and the two girls started to run toward the infirmary.

———————————————————

Aster laid on the infirmary bed, unconscious and pale. Marigold had to force her way inside. The story of a unknown creature attacking a student was one that no one wanted to miss. They expected Aster to be deformed and bandaged up, and much to everyone’s disappointment, she was physically fine.

When one hears that a student is attacked by some unknown creature, they want to see grotesque scars at the very least!

Vivien and Lottie arrived at the infirmary moments after Marigold forced herself in. Poppy, the school’s nurse, kept students away because at the time, Aster was in a state of shock and only just a few moments ago was she given a sleeping and dreamless draught to ease her mind and allow her to rest.

“What are you doing here Marigold?” Vivien asked with some attitude but this was more out of protectiveness. Vivien had seen how Marigold bullied Aster earlier this year and she didn’t know that the two girls had made up.

“I heard Aster was attacked!” Marigold screamed in full concern.

“Girls!” Poppy was stern, “if you cannot keep your voices down, you will leave. She needs her rest.”

Lottie asked, “what happened to her? Was she really attacked by a monster?” Fear was laced in her voice. All the girls looked at Poppy with some fear for their friend.

Poppy shook her head, “I can’t reveal what happened. We’re still trying to figure it out ourselves. But she hadn’t slept all night and she was in shock when she was brought in. Physically she’s okay,” Poppy said and sighs of relief was heard from Marigold and Lottie. Vivien however didn’t relax, “but what about her mind?”

Poppy shook her head, “she was in shock and crying hysterically. Poor girl couldn’t even finish her sentences. She just kept babbling.”

Marigold sat down on the bed, pulling Aster’s head in her lap. This freaked out Lottie and Vivien greatly. “Excuse you! What do you think you are doing?” Vivien asked, her face red with angry.

“I’m trying to comfort her. She’s still tense,” Marigold said, pointed to Aster’s hands, which had been gripping the blanket from underneath. Lottie looked at Marigold, seemingly understanding the subconscious mind. Seeing how much Aster had visibly relaxed just after being in Marigold’s arms, Lottie asked, “how long?”

Vivien raised an eyebrow, but looked at Marigold. The red hair stared hard at the two girls, “since we both got Dragon Pox in December.” Lottie sighed softly, and sat on the foot of the bed, and pulled out a book that she had almost forgotten that she had on her. It was old and torn up, but it was Jerry Bloomer, the first book in the series, “that’s Aster’s favorite book. Some people can unconsciously hear when people read to them.”

“Lottie, what are you doing?” Vivien asked.

“Offering some comfort for our friend,” she stared at Vivien hard, something she wasn’t used to doing. “Aster needs support, she doesn’t need us to fight. Just look around. We’re the only ones she’s got.”

Vivien looked around and did notice it was just then plus Poppy, who was letting the girls sort things out. “Hey…where is Sam and Ace anyways?”

“Sam is taking class notes for me and I guess for all of us,” Lottie said and looked around the room. “And Ace…well, since he’s in Hufflepuff as well, he’s being talked to about what happened last night. All the students in the house all woke up and many of them freaked out. Some even claim to have seen the monster.”

“So why isn’t James here?” Marigold suddenly asked, laying her down for a moment but only to move so that she could lay down with her on the bed.

“If you knew Aster, you would know that James can’t stand her,” Vivien said and then really got mad, “why are you laying down with her?”

“Vivi, look,” Lottie stopped her and saw his Marigold turned Aster to her side and began hugging her from behind. Lottie held the book in her hands and said, “do you care if I start reading to her? This really is her favorite story. Jerry Bloomer and the Heart-Stone.

Vivien pouted a bit as Lottie was getting set up. That was until she decided to sit down beside the bed, and pulled out her wand, pulling the curtains around then to be closed off. Vivien looked at Lottie, “start reading the book Lottie. We only have until lunch and then we have to go to class,” she said as she glared at Marigold, still not trusting her to being so close to her best friend.

Lottie nodded and opened the book and began reading, “Mr. and Mrs. Hayworth, of number seven, Rutledge Road, we’re proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much…”

summary: Make it Stop - Ron Weasley x Reader
title: Make it Stop - Ron Weasley x Reader
body:
Request:  I was wondering if you could do a post or fic where the reader is Harry Potter’s younger sister and is dating Ron Weasley. And somehow Harry finds out and decides to be a “Protective Older Brother” and gives the TALK to his sister and also goes into Big Brother mode at Ron. -  princessroselyn 

Warning: Awkwardness- but this was given, Mentions the nasty ;)

Italics: Past

Y/N: Your name

It was a Friday morning and you were having breakfast at the Gryffindor table with your brother Harry and both your best friend’s Ron and Hermione. Even though you were a year younger than Harry, you grew accustom to always having the two around and naturally formed a bond with them. However as time passed, you grew really accustom to the ginger haired boy who we all call Ron Weasley. Something about him made you feel drawn to his persona and the feeling was mutual. 

However, there was one slight problem.

Harry.

Harry was your best friend, but so is Ron. You didn’t know how your older brother would feel that his little sister is dating his best friend. Especially with his overprotectiveness. You know he means well, but you don’t have any other choice but to hide it. It was for the best. Both for you and him.

You remember the very day that Ron asked you to be his girlfriend like it was yesterday:

It was Christmas time and Harry and Hermione had left to bring back butter beer for everyone. You had on your ugly sweater and sat in front of the fire warming your hands as the cold snowy weather fell from outside. You closed your eyes in bliss, as you were very very cold. You heard Ron chuckle from behind you, and you whipped your head around, giving him a playful glare.

“What are you laughing at, Carrot-top?” you teased. He smiled and began to fidget with his thumbs.

“Oh nothing, just admiring you being dramatic about the weather as always,” he retorted. You gasped, and threw your hand to your chest.

“Dramatic! I am anemic and possibly get hypothermia!” you joked. He rolled his eyes.

“Exactly my point, Drama Queen,” he smirked. You huffed and returned back to the fire, muttering a ‘whatever.’

Ron made his way over to you and sat down, in front of the fire. 

“Come to gloat some more?” you sighed and rested your head on his shoulders. A blush rose to his pale cheeks.

“N-No, uhm actually, I wanted to ask you something, Y/N,” he nervously spoke. You raised your head and looked at him, tilting your head slightly, raising your eyebrow.

“What?” You asked softly. You noticed Ron nervously nibbling on the inside of his lip as he took a shaky breath. Furrowing your eyebrows, you put your hand on top of his, to calm him down. “Is everything all right?”

“Well.. I don’t know how this is going to go and if I am pressuring you or making you feel uncomfortable in any way, do let me know and I will stop,” he spoke, only making you more confused by the second, but you nodded, “Here goes nothing. Y/N you’re beautiful. Gorgeous, a Goddess, absolutely stunning, bloody brilliant! Your laugh is like music to my ears and every time you smile you make the whole room light up. I swear to it, my heart skips a beat whenever I am in your presence. Just brilliant. You’re so caring and generous in almost every instance.. and I just don’t understand how you do it, but you do. I’m so blessed to have met you, even if it is through Harry, because you are truly a blessing in my life. Your personality is beyond extravagant. It’s just… so… unique. It’s brilliant. Bloody brilliant, really. You are brilliant. But, what I’m trying to say is, would you like to be my girlfriend?” He gushed.

You stared at the red-headed boy for a minute. His face was almost as red as his hair. You threw yourself forward, crashing your lips onto his. Taken back by surprise, Ron almost feel backwards, but caught you in his arms. As you pulled away, you smiled.

“S-So, is that a yes?” he blushed.

Ron is an awkward person, but so are you in some ways so it evens out perfectly. Currently, All four of you, Harry, Hermione, Ron, and you, are hanging around Diagon Alley, just enjoy each others company.

“Oh, look, Ron! It’s your brothers shop Weasley’s Wizard Wheezes!” you gawk, “Let’s go inside!”

“It’s nothing but a bunch of rubbish,” Ron mumbled. You rolled your eyes.

“Oh, c’mon. Don’t be such a sleaze,” Hermione joined in, and linked arms with you, walking towards the shop. Ron looked at Harry and he shrugged.

“Let’s have a look,” Harry said.

You all entered and looked around amazed at your surroundings. The shop contained practical joke objects, such as Extendable Ears, a Reusable Hangman, Skiving Snackboxes, and Fred and George’s special WonderWitch products, such as; Love Potions, Ten-Second Pimple Vanishers, Pygmy Puffs, and more. You squealed in excitement and hopped up the stairs to look around.

You found a hat floating above you and placed perfectly on top of your head. It began to purr and you giggled.

“It’s a Titfer-Wanderer. It’s seems to have taken a liking to you,” George appeared, grinning at you. You raised your arm and began to lightly pet the hat and it vibrated in joy.

“Hello, little Potter,” Fred spoke, on the opposite side of you that George was. You gave them both a big hug. They were like your second brothers from another mother.

“Nice store you’ve got going on here, you smiled as the Titfer floated off of your head and to somewhere else in the store.

“We know,” they said in unison. They tend to do that a lot, “What brings you here?”

“Just taking a gander,” you replied as Ron showed up next to you.

“Well, isn’t it our younger brother,” Fred joked, roughly slapping Ron on the back. He groaned, annoyed.

“Can we go,” Ron said, turning to you. You huffed and nodded.

“Fine,” you pouted and linked arms with Ron. George eyed you both up and down, noticing how comfortable Ron was acting with you. He elbowed Fred in the ribs slightly and gestured to the two of you slightly. Fred also looked at you two and squinted his eyes. Usually, Ron was always shy around you and wouldn’t dare get too close enough to touch you, let alone link arms.

“See you, Fred and George,” you smiled as Ron pulled you away.

“Mhmm…,” they said in unison, watching the two of you leave the store.

Ron pulled you around the corner of the building as Harry and Hermione were still inside. “They tried to charge me full price for a small orb, can you believe it? I”m their brother,” he complained.

You gave a little smirk. “Well, to be fair, they are trying to make business.”

“Yes, but it was one teeny little orb. They’re bonkers to think I’m paying $45 for it.” You gave a little laugh and wrapped your arms around his neck, leaning into his touch as he grabbed your waist. You pressed your lips to his as he deepened the kiss.

“BLOODY HELL!”

You and Ron immediately pulled away as you  both turned towards the loud outburst. You blushed, scratching the side of your head as you looked into your brother’s shocked eyes. Next to him stood Fred and George, grinning.

“Good luck with that one, little brother and little Potter,” they joked and walked back inside, winking.

“Does anyone care to explain what’s going on?!” Harry exclaimed. Ron, was at a loss of words. What was he going to tell his best friend? You decided to speak up.

“It’s not what it looks like,” you began.

“Oh really, so my best friend and little sister were not just snogging a couple seconds ago?” he retorted. You cringed at his tone of voice.

“Okay- it’s exactly what it looks like, BUT-”

“Back to Hogwarts in the Gryffindor common room. Now,” Harry demanded and walked away.

You sighed and looked up at Ron. He looked back down at you with a worried expression.

“You’re the one who wanted to come here,” he mumbled. You gasped.

“Excuse me, you’re the one who pulled me outside to snog-”

“Now!” Harry snapped. You both hung your head, and trailed behind. Hermione came skipping out the store, completely oblivious to what happened seconds ago.

“How long?” Harry spoke, sitting across from the both of you in the Gryffindor common room. He didn’t break eye contact once, with the either of you.

“Just a couple months,” Ron spoke.

“How. Long?” he asked again.

“Four months,” you finished, playing with your thumbs. Harry took a deep breath, leaning into the both of his hands. He then rubbed his hands down his face and looked at you in dead silence. All the three of you could do was awkwardly stare.

“Okay. We are going to talk about where babies come from. Do you know anything about intercourse?” Harry began. Ron groaned, completely embarrassed.

“Oh for goodness sakes, Harry! I’ve been getting my bloody period for six years!” you exclaimed, hiding your face in your hands, mortified that he even brought up this type of discussion.

“Yes, I very well know this, but you guys must understand that you are going to get… erm.. sexual impulses and want to act upon them. And it’s completely natural! But I am going to say this as your brother, Y/N, and your best friend, Ron, ignore them!” he snapped. You groaned in embarrassment as Ron could do nothing but fiddle with his thumbs.

“And I’m not just talking about intercourse. Ron, I know you are going to try and do vile things to my little sister. Just vile! But I’m telling you this right now, you must also control these impulses towards other sexual acts. This goes for you too Y/N. Things such as masterbating, blowjo-”

“HARRY!” you shouted, “BLOODY STOP!” 

You couldn’t take anymore. This had to stop. You looked at Ron and he couldn’t have looked more awkward. His face was as red as a tomato, and if it had gotten anymore red, you were sure he was going to explode.

“Make it stop,” you moaned. “I am going to leave if you continue.”

“Next time, I expect you to inform me of something like this happening and this all could have been avoided,” Harry shrugged, putting his hands up in defense.

“Yeah, we get it. I’m sorry, I’ll never hide anything from you again” you mumbled, rolling your eyes.

“You’re both still my family, and if there was anyone that I’d want you dating, I’m glad it’s someone that I can safely call my best friend,” He grinned, getting up to give both you and Ron a tight hug. You both hugged back, happy that he wasn’t mad.

“But if I ever find out that you’ve hurt my sister, consider yourself dead Ronald Weasley. Understood?” Harry said, giving Ron a dead stare. Ron nodded vigorously.

“Understood, Harry,” he said. You rolled your eyes and linked your hand with Ron’s. 

“Alright enough of this, I’m over it. Let’s go,” you said pulling Ron with you, heading to leave the room and go anywhere Harry wasn’t.

“I’M SERIOUS ABOUT THE BIRDS AND THE BEES!” Harry called after you two.

“BLOODY HELL, HARRY!” you yelled back, and hurried away with Ron.

It was a Friday morning and you were having breakfast at the Gryffindor table with your brother Harry and both your best friend’s Ron and Hermione. Even though you were a year younger than Harry, you grew accustom to always having the two around and naturally formed a bond with them. However as time passed, you grew really accustom to the ginger haired boy who we all call Ron Weasley. Something about him made you feel drawn to his persona and the feeling was mutual. 

However, there was one slight problem.

Harry.

Harry was your best friend, but so is Ron. You didn’t know how your older brother would feel that his little sister is dating his best friend. Especially with his overprotectiveness. You know he means well, but you don’t have any other choice but to hide it. It was for the best. Both for you and him.

You remember the very day that Ron asked you to be his girlfriend like it was yesterday:

It was Christmas time and Harry and Hermione had left to bring back butter beer for everyone. You had on your ugly sweater and sat in front of the fire warming your hands as the cold snowy weather fell from outside. You closed your eyes in bliss, as you were very very cold. You heard Ron chuckle from behind you, and you whipped your head around, giving him a playful glare.

“What are you laughing at, Carrot-top?” you teased. He smiled and began to fidget with his thumbs.

“Oh nothing, just admiring you being dramatic about the weather as always,” he retorted. You gasped, and threw your hand to your chest.

“Dramatic! I am anemic and possibly get hypothermia!” you joked. He rolled his eyes.

“Exactly my point, Drama Queen,” he smirked. You huffed and returned back to the fire, muttering a ‘whatever.’

Ron made his way over to you and sat down, in front of the fire. 

“Come to gloat some more?” you sighed and rested your head on his shoulders. A blush rose to his pale cheeks.

“N-No, uhm actually, I wanted to ask you something, Y/N,” he nervously spoke. You raised your head and looked at him, tilting your head slightly, raising your eyebrow.

“What?” You asked softly. You noticed Ron nervously nibbling on the inside of his lip as he took a shaky breath. Furrowing your eyebrows, you put your hand on top of his, to calm him down. “Is everything all right?”

“Well.. I don’t know how this is going to go and if I am pressuring you or making you feel uncomfortable in any way, do let me know and I will stop,” he spoke, only making you more confused by the second, but you nodded, “Here goes nothing. Y/N you’re beautiful. Gorgeous, a Goddess, absolutely stunning, bloody brilliant! Your laugh is like music to my ears and every time you smile you make the whole room light up. I swear to it, my heart skips a beat whenever I am in your presence. Just brilliant. You’re so caring and generous in almost every instance.. and I just don’t understand how you do it, but you do. I’m so blessed to have met you, even if it is through Harry, because you are truly a blessing in my life. Your personality is beyond extravagant. It’s just… so… unique. It’s brilliant. Bloody brilliant, really. You are brilliant. But, what I’m trying to say is, would you like to be my girlfriend?” He gushed.

You stared at the red-headed boy for a minute. His face was almost as red as his hair. You threw yourself forward, crashing your lips onto his. Taken back by surprise, Ron almost feel backwards, but caught you in his arms. As you pulled away, you smiled.

“S-So, is that a yes?” he blushed.

Ron is an awkward person, but so are you in some ways so it evens out perfectly. Currently, All four of you, Harry, Hermione, Ron, and you, are hanging around Diagon Alley, just enjoy each others company.

“Oh, look, Ron! It’s your brothers shop Weasley’s Wizard Wheezes!” you gawk, “Let’s go inside!”

“It’s nothing but a bunch of rubbish,” Ron mumbled. You rolled your eyes.

“Oh, c’mon. Don’t be such a sleaze,” Hermione joined in, and linked arms with you, walking towards the shop. Ron looked at Harry and he shrugged.

“Let’s have a look,” Harry said.

You all entered and looked around amazed at your surroundings. The shop contained practical joke objects, such as Extendable Ears, a Reusable Hangman, Skiving Snackboxes, and Fred and George’s special WonderWitch products, such as; Love Potions, Ten-Second Pimple Vanishers, Pygmy Puffs, and more. You squealed in excitement and hopped up the stairs to look around.

You found a hat floating above you and placed perfectly on top of your head. It began to purr and you giggled.

“It’s a Titfer-Wanderer. It’s seems to have taken a liking to you,” George appeared, grinning at you. You raised your arm and began to lightly pet the hat and it vibrated in joy.

“Hello, little Potter,” Fred spoke, on the opposite side of you that George was. You gave them both a big hug. They were like your second brothers from another mother.

“Nice store you’ve got going on here, you smiled as the Titfer floated off of your head and to somewhere else in the store.

“We know,” they said in unison. They tend to do that a lot, “What brings you here?”

“Just taking a gander,” you replied as Ron showed up next to you.

“Well, isn’t it our younger brother,” Fred joked, roughly slapping Ron on the back. He groaned, annoyed.

“Can we go,” Ron said, turning to you. You huffed and nodded.

“Fine,” you pouted and linked arms with Ron. George eyed you both up and down, noticing how comfortable Ron was acting with you. He elbowed Fred in the ribs slightly and gestured to the two of you slightly. Fred also looked at you two and squinted his eyes. Usually, Ron was always shy around you and wouldn’t dare get too close enough to touch you, let alone link arms.

“See you, Fred and George,” you smiled as Ron pulled you away.

“Mhmm…,” they said in unison, watching the two of you leave the store.

Ron pulled you around the corner of the building as Harry and Hermione were still inside. “They tried to charge me full price for a small orb, can you believe it? I”m their brother,” he complained.

You gave a little smirk. “Well, to be fair, they are trying to make business.”

“Yes, but it was one teeny little orb. They’re bonkers to think I’m paying $45 for it.” You gave a little laugh and wrapped your arms around his neck, leaning into his touch as he grabbed your waist. You pressed your lips to his as he deepened the kiss.

“BLOODY HELL!”

You and Ron immediately pulled away as you  both turned towards the loud outburst. You blushed, scratching the side of your head as you looked into your brother’s shocked eyes. Next to him stood Fred and George, grinning.

“Good luck with that one, little brother and little Potter,” they joked and walked back inside, winking.

“Does anyone care to explain what’s going on?!” Harry exclaimed. Ron, was at a loss of words. What was he going to tell his best friend? You decided to speak up.

“It’s not what it looks like,” you began.

“Oh really, so my best friend and little sister were not just snogging a couple seconds ago?” he retorted. You cringed at his tone of voice.

“Okay- it’s exactly what it looks like, BUT-”

“Back to Hogwarts in the Gryffindor common room. Now,” Harry demanded and walked away.

You sighed and looked up at Ron. He looked back down at you with a worried expression.

“You’re the one who wanted to come here,” he mumbled. You gasped.

“Excuse me, you’re the one who pulled me outside to snog-”

“Now!” Harry snapped. You both hung your head, and trailed behind. Hermione came skipping out the store, completely oblivious to what happened seconds ago.

“How long?” Harry spoke, sitting across from the both of you in the Gryffindor common room. He didn’t break eye contact once, with the either of you.

“Just a couple months,” Ron spoke.

“How. Long?” he asked again.

“Four months,” you finished, playing with your thumbs. Harry took a deep breath, leaning into the both of his hands. He then rubbed his hands down his face and looked at you in dead silence. All the three of you could do was awkwardly stare.

“Okay. We are going to talk about where babies come from. Do you know anything about intercourse?” Harry began. Ron groaned, completely embarrassed.

“Oh for goodness sakes, Harry! I’ve been getting my bloody period for six years!” you exclaimed, hiding your face in your hands, mortified that he even brought up this type of discussion.

“Yes, I very well know this, but you guys must understand that you are going to get… erm.. sexual impulses and want to act upon them. And it’s completely natural! But I am going to say this as your brother, Y/N, and your best friend, Ron, ignore them!” he snapped. You groaned in embarrassment as Ron could do nothing but fiddle with his thumbs.

“And I’m not just talking about intercourse. Ron, I know you are going to try and do vile things to my little sister. Just vile! But I’m telling you this right now, you must also control these impulses towards other sexual acts. This goes for you too Y/N. Things such as masterbating, blowjo-”

“HARRY!” you shouted, “BLOODY STOP!” 

You couldn’t take anymore. This had to stop. You looked at Ron and he couldn’t have looked more awkward. His face was as red as a tomato, and if it had gotten anymore red, you were sure he was going to explode.

“Make it stop,” you moaned. “I am going to leave if you continue.”

“Next time, I expect you to inform me of something like this happening and this all could have been avoided,” Harry shrugged, putting his hands up in defense.

“Yeah, we get it. I’m sorry, I’ll never hide anything from you again” you mumbled, rolling your eyes.

“You’re both still my family, and if there was anyone that I’d want you dating, I’m glad it’s someone that I can safely call my best friend,” He grinned, getting up to give both you and Ron a tight hug. You both hugged back, happy that he wasn’t mad.

“But if I ever find out that you’ve hurt my sister, consider yourself dead Ronald Weasley. Understood?” Harry said, giving Ron a dead stare. Ron nodded vigorously.

“Understood, Harry,” he said. You rolled your eyes and linked your hand with Ron’s. 

“Alright enough of this, I’m over it. Let’s go,” you said pulling Ron with you, heading to leave the room and go anywhere Harry wasn’t.

“I’M SERIOUS ABOUT THE BIRDS AND THE BEES!” Harry called after you two.

“BLOODY HELL, HARRY!” you yelled back, and hurried away with Ron.
